page.title: 09Employment 1945
page.content:
NEWBRIDGE IN 1945 _________________ Did you have a job? Yes I did have a paper round every morning and I had 12.5 new pence a week.
Q.What was the average wage for men? The average wage for men in 1945 was Â£2.00 (new money) a week.
Q.Where did men and women go out for entertainment? Cinemas were appearing in 1945, every village had one. The film was changed twice a week, Mondays, Tuesdays and Wednesdays and another film on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. On a Saturday night prices ranged from 2.5p for front row and 1'6(7.5p) on the balcony.
